_comment: Codex CLI MCP Configuration Template for SDL-MCP

_documentation.purpose: Configure SDL-MCP as an MCP server for Codex CLI
_documentation.placement: Add to Codex MCP servers configuration

windowsNotes.paths: Use forward slashes (/) or escaped backslashes (\\)
windowsNotes.npx: npx works cross-platform. For global install, use 'sdl-mcp' directly
windowsNotes.environment: SDL_CONFIG_PATH or SDL_CONFIG must point to sdlmcp.config.json

quoting.cmd: Use double quotes for paths with spaces, no single quotes
quoting.powershell: Single quotes work, but cmd is more portable for cross-platform configs

workspaceFolder.windows: Resolves correctly on Windows with forward slashes

_alternative_global_install.description: If globally installed with 'npm install -g sdl-mcp':

notes: If using custom paths, use double backslashes: C:\\Users\\name\\.nvm\\versions\\node\\node.exe
SDL_CONFIG path uses forward slashes for cross-platform compatibility
If workspaceFolder has spaces, Codex CLI handles quoting automatically

_troubleshooting.npx_fails: If npx fails, try 'npm config set script-shell pwsh' (PowerShell) or use global install
_troubleshooting.path_not_found: Verify SDL_CONFIG path exists and is accessible
_troubleshooting.permissions: Ensure Node.js has read access to config file and database path
